properties.headline: Flood Warning issued January 10 at 11:09AM EST until January 14 at 12:00PM EST by NWS Indianapolis IN
properties.description:
...A Flood Warning continues for portions of the following waterways
in Indiana...

Big Blue River...Driftwood River...Eagle Creek...East Fork White
River...Eel River...Flatrock River...Mill Creek...Mississinewa
River...Sugar Creek...Tippecanoe River...Wabash River...White
River...Wildcat Creek...Youngs Creek...


.With rainfall totals between 1 to 2 inches there are
widespread flooding concerns across much of Indiana. Over the next
couple of days we will see another 1 to 3 inches of rain or more
possible.

The Flood Warning continues for
The White River at Anderson.
* from Saturday evening to Tuesday afternoon.
* At 10:30 AM Friday the stage was 5.6 feet.
* Flood stage is 10.0 feet.
* Minor flooding is forecast.
* Forecast...Rise above flood stage by Saturday evening and continue
to rise to near 12.0 feet by Sunday evening.  It will fall below
flood stage by late Monday night.
* At 12.0 feet...Flooding of Irondale Park, Madison Avenue Park,
Mounds State Park, and low agricultural land begins.  Grand Avenue
east of Broadway Street Bridge is nearly impassable.  City of
Anderson closes off Edgewater Park.
properties.instruction:
Precautionary/Preparedness Actions...

Motorists should never drive into flood water. Turn around and go
another way. Keep children away from flooded areas. Recreational and
agricultural interests should remain alert to changing river
conditions.

For detailed flood information go to weather.gov/ind on the web and
click on rivers and lakes.
